page.title: 04Recreation for the Young
page.content: For the hard-up youth of the area the amenities are insufficient and too expensive. What they enjoy is Machine Arcades, Cafes, Youth Clubs,Discos, Clubs, Cinemas, Pool Halls, etc.. Although towns like Truro do not have enough, outlying districts have even less. A lack of amenities coupled with unemployment and underage drinking may contribute to increased vandalism assisted by the presence of too few police. Tourism is important to the area for jobs and money but there is a general distrust of foreigners who cause prices for local people to rise, leave rubbish everywhere and cause traffic jams. Church is not well attended by the young and opinion is split concerning Nuclear war but generally most accept the possibility, are resigned to it, and then choose to forget about it.
